bioclim_01.description: The annual mean temperature approximates the total energy inputs for an ecosystem.

bioclim_02.long_name: Bioclim 02: Mean Diurnal Range (Mean of monthly (max temp - min temp))
bioclim_02.description: This index can help provide information pertaining to the relevance of temperature fluctuation for different species.

bioclim_03.description: Isothermality quantifies how large the day-to-night temperatures oscillate relative to the summer- to-winter (annual) oscillations. An isothermal value of 100 indicates the diurnal temperature range is equiva- lent to the annual temperature range, while anything less than 100 indicates a smaller level of temperature variability within an average month relative to the year. A species distribution may be influenced by larger or smaller temperature fluctuations within a month relative to the year and this predictor is useful for ascertaining such information.

bioclim_04.description: Temperature seasonality is a measure of temperature change over the course of the year. The larger the value, the greater the variability of temperature.

bioclim_05.long_name: Bioclim 05: Max Temperature of Warmest Month
bioclim_05.description: This information is useful when examining whether species distributions are affected by warm temperature anomalies throughout the year.

bioclim_06.long_name: Bioclim 06: Min Temperature of Coldest Month
bioclim_06.description: This information is useful when examining whether species distributions are affected by cold temperature anomalies throughout the year.

bioclim_07.description: This information is useful when examining whether species distributions are affected by ranges of extreme temperature conditions.

bioclim_08.long_name: Bioclim 08: Mean Temperature of Wettest Quarter
bioclim_08.description: This index provides mean temperatures during the wettest three months of the year, which can be useful for examining how such environmental factors may affect species seasonal distributions.

bioclim_09.long_name: Bioclim 09: Mean Temperature of Driest Quarter
bioclim_09.description: This index provides mean temperatures during the driest three months of the year, which can be useful for examining how such environmental factors may affect species seasonal distributions.

bioclim_10.long_name: Bioclim 10: Mean Temperature of Warmest Quarter
bioclim_10.description: This index provides mean temperatures during the warmest three months of the year, which can be useful for examining how such environmental factors may affect species seasonal distributions.

bioclim_11.long_name: Bioclim 11: Mean Temperature of Coldest Quarter
bioclim_11.description: This index provides mean temperatures during the coldest three months of the year, which can be useful for examining how such environmental factors may affect species seasonal distributions.

bioclim_12.description: Annual total precipitation approximates the total water inputs and is therefore useful when ascertaining the importance of water availability to a species distribution.

bioclim_13.description: The wettest month is useful if extreme precipitation conditions during the year influence a species potential range.

bioclim_14.description: The driest month is useful if extreme precipitation conditions during the year influence a species potential range.

bioclim_15.description: Since species distributions can be strongly influenced by variability in precipitation, this index provides a percentage of precipitation variability where larger percentages represent greater variability of precipitation.

bioclim_16.description: This index provides total precipitation during the wettest three months of the year, which can be useful for examining how such environmental factors may affect species seasonal distributions.

bioclim_17.description: This index provides total precipitation during the driest three months of the year, which can be useful for examining how such environmental factors may affect species seasonal distributions.

bioclim_18.description: This index provides total precipitation during the warmest three months of the year, which can be useful for examining how such environmental factors may affect species seasonal distributions.

bioclim_19.description: This index provides total precipitation during the coldest three months of the year, which can be useful for examining how such environmental factors may affect species seasonal distributions.

bioclim_20.description: This is the annual mean solar radiation.

bioclim_21.description: This is the highest weekly solar radiation.

bioclim_22.description: This is the lowest weekly solar radiation.

bioclim_23.description: This is the Radiation Seasonality (Coefficient of Variation).

bioclim_24.description: This is the solar radiation of wettest quarter.

bioclim_25.description: This is the solar radiation of driest quarter.

bioclim_26.description: This is the solar radiation of warmest quarter.

bioclim_27.description: This is the solar radiation of coldest quarter.

bioclim_28.description: This is the annual mean moisture index.

bioclim_29.description: This is the highest weekly moisture index.

bioclim_30.description: This is the lowest weekly moisture index.

bioclim_31.description: This is the moisture index seasonality (coefficient of variation).

bioclim_32.long_name: Bioclim 32: Mean moisture index of wettest quarter
bioclim_32.description: This is the annual mean moisture index of the wettest quarter.

bioclim_33.long_name: Bioclim 33: Mean moisture index of driest quarter
bioclim_33.description: This is the annual mean moisture index of the driest quarter.

bioclim_34.long_name: Bioclim 34: Mean moisture index of warmest quarter
bioclim_34.description: This is the annual mean moisture index of the warmest quarter.

bioclim_35.long_name: Bioclim 35: Mean moisture index of coldest quarter
bioclim_35.description: This is the annual mean moisture index of the coldest quarter.
